items.title: Exercise 1: Performance Appraisal Summary (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Annual Performance Appraisal: Alex Thompson

Review Period: Jan - Dec
Manager: Sarah Jenkins

Key Achievements:
- Successfully migrated all legacy files to the cloud system. It was Alex's dedication that ensured the project was completed 2 weeks early.
- Consistently met all monthly KPIs for data accuracy.
- What impressed the management team most was Alex's proactive approach to resolving the March server crisis.

Areas for Development:
- Inter-departmental communication: It is the lack of regular updates that sometimes causes friction with the Sales team.
- Time management for non-urgent tasks.

SMART Goal for Q1: Improve reporting speed. Specifically, Alex will deliver the weekly audit report by Thursday 4 PM for the next 12 weeks.

questions.question: What specifically helped Alex finish the cloud migration project early?
questions.explanation: Doc A states: 'It was Alex's dedication that ensured the project was completed 2 weeks early.'

questions.question: What is identified as a cause of friction with the Sales team?
questions.explanation: Doc A says: 'It is the lack of regular updates that sometimes causes friction...'

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Performance Concepts. What does the 'S' in SMART goals stand for?
items.explanation: In the SMART framework, goals must be 'Specific'.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Performance Improvement. What does 'PIP' stand for in an HR context?
items.explanation: A PIP (Performance Improvement Plan) is used to help an underperforming employee.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Operational Chunks. Complete the sentence: 'We need to provide ___ feedback to help the employee ___ their KPIs.'
items.explanation: The standard professional approach is to provide 'constructive feedback' to help someone 'meet their KPIs'.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: It-Cleft. Rewrite this sentence for emphasis starting with 'It was': 'The CEO approved the budget increase.'
items.modelAnswer: It was the CEO who approved the budget increase.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: What-Cleft. Rewrite this sentence for emphasis starting with 'What': 'We need more training on GDPR.'
items.modelAnswer: What we need is more training on GDPR.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Data. Based on Doc A, identify one key strength and one area for development for Alex.
items.modelAnswer: Strength: Proactive approach to crisis / Data accuracy. Development: Inter-departmental communication / Time management.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. How would you professionally invite an employee to their annual appraisal meeting?
options: Come to my office now for your review.
Your appraisal is today at 2 PM.
Could you please confirm your availability for your annual appraisal on Wednesday afternoon?
I wish you would come to your appraisal.
items.explanation: This is a polite and professional way to schedule a formal meeting.

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Feedback Email. Write a short email (50-70 words) providing constructive feedback to a colleague about their reporting style. Use a what-cleft for emphasis.
items.modelAnswer: Hi John, I’ve reviewed your latest project update. What I found particularly useful was the detailed timeline. However, it would be even more effective if we could simplify the data tables for the stakeholders. It is the clarity of the figures that helps them make quick decisions. Let’s discuss this in our next 1-to-1. Thanks, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Performance Monitoring. What does 'KPI' stand for?
items.explanation: KPI stands for Key Performance Indicator.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Feedback Session. Record a 2-minute audio providing positive feedback to an employee. Use at least one cleft sentence (e.g., 'What I liked most was...').
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Professional tone, Specificity of feedback, Correct use of Cleft Sentence.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Goal Setting. Record a 60-second clip setting a SMART goal for a team member. Use 'It is [this goal] that will...' to emphasize its importance.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: SMART criteria, Use of Cleft Sentence, Clear action.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Appraisal Summary Report (Portfolio). Write a 150-word appraisal summary for a hypothetical 'Junior Admin'. Use at least two cleft sentences to highlight key points.
items.modelAnswer:
Appraisal Summary: Junior Administrator

During the last six months, the employee has integrated well into the Operations team. What impressed me most was their rapid mastery of the procurement software. It was their initiative that led to the successful digitisation of our vendor logs, which has significantly reduced retrieval time.

In terms of KPIs, the employee has consistently achieved a 98% accuracy rate in data entry. However, we have identified a need for better task prioritisation. It is the occasional missed deadline for non-urgent requests that we need to address in the next quarter.

SMART Goal: The employee will attend a 'Time Management' workshop and implement a daily prioritisation list. By the end of Q3, we expect to see a 100% on-time delivery rate for all administrative tasks. What we need for the next phase is a continued focus on professional growth and attention to detail.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: SMART Goal Template. Complete a SMART goal for 'Improving Email Response Time'.
items.modelAnswer: Specific: Reduce average response time. Measurable: From 4 hours to 2 hours. Achievable: Yes, with better filtering. Relevant: Customer service quality. Time-bound: Within 3 months.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) Define KPI. 2) What is a 'PIP'? 3) Complete the cleft sentence: 'What we need ___ (be) more resources.' 4) What does the 'R' in SMART stand for?
items.modelAnswer: 1) Key Performance Indicator. 2) Performance Improvement Plan. 3) ...is... 4) Relevant.
